intro: Lachemilla lechleriana, commonly known as the Andean stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming structure. The plant features fleshy, succulent leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, which bloom in early spring. Lachemilla lechleriana is well adapted to high-altitude environments and prefers well-drained, rocky soils.
